meanings.definition: In a greedy or covetous manner.
meanings.sent1: He looked avariciously at the pile of gold coins, wanting them all for himself.
meanings.sent2: She avariciously grabbed all the cookies from the jar before anyone else could have one.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel avariciously hoarded all the acorns in the forest, leaving none for the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The child's eyes gleamed avariciously as he spotted the colorful candies in the store.
meanings.sent5: The dragon avariciously guarded its treasure hoard, not letting anyone near it.

meanings.definition: Showing an extreme desire for wealth or material gain.
meanings.sent1: The avariciously businessman would do anything to increase his profits, even if it meant cheating others.
meanings.sent2: She had an avariciously ambitious plan to become the richest person in town.
meanings.sent3: The avariciously cat kept trying to steal shiny objects to add to its collection.
meanings.sent4: The avariciously queen demanded more and more jewels to adorn her royal attire.
meanings.sent5: The avariciously pirate sailed the seas in search of hidden treasures to satisfy his endless greed.
